title: This Relaxed Everlane Silk Blouse (That’s an Equipment Dupe) Is on Sale (Again)
text:
1 item in this article Photo: Courtesy of the vendor

Recently, we noticed that one of Everlane’s classic silk shirts was on sale. As we wrote then: “Everlane does a lot of things well, but its women’s silk shirts are beloved. ‘I get compliments and asked ‘Where’s that from?’ every single time I wear one of my silk blouses,’ says writer and Everlaneologist Robin Reetz. This relaxed silk button-down is especially suited to this transitional weather — when it’s cool enough to wear something warmer than a T-shirt but still too hot to commit to a sweater. In terms of style, this is a straight-up dupe for the versatile button-downs from Parisian brand Equipment, meaning it’s an easy shirt to throw on and dress up (or down) for any occasion.”

Right now, said shirt (which is no longer available in blue, but in this lovely olive-green shade as well as in light yellow and mint) is just $59, 40 percent off the already-reasonable regular price of $98, making it an even better deal than usual. (Note: It’s a little more expensive than the aforementioned shirt we wrote about a few weeks ago since it’s made from Everlane’s ecoconscious Clean Silk fabric.)
